title: Wine Tasting Vocabulary
description: Master the specialized language of wine tasting, from aroma descriptions to vineyard terms

questions.question: In wine tasting, what does 'tannin' refer to?
options: A naturally occurring compound that creates a dry, puckering sensation in the mouth

questions.question: What does 'terroir' mean in the wine world?
options: The complete natural environment in which a wine is produced, including soil, climate, and topography

questions.question: In wine terminology, what does 'bouquet' describe?
options: The complex aromas that develop in wine as it ages in the bottle

questions.question: What does it mean when a wine is described as having 'body'?
options: The weight and fullness of the wine on the palate, from light to full

questions.question: In wine tasting, what are 'legs' or 'tears'?
options: The droplets of wine that cling to and run down the inside of the glass after swirling

questions.question: What does 'vintage' specifically refer to in wine?
options: The year in which the grapes were harvested

questions.question: In wine terminology, what does 'decanting' involve?
options: Slowly pouring wine from its bottle into another vessel to separate it from sediment and aerate it

questions.question: What does 'dry' mean when describing a wine?
options: The wine has little to no residual sugar, not tasting sweet

questions.question: In wine tasting, what does 'finish' refer to?
options: The flavors and sensations that linger in the mouth after swallowing

questions.question: What is a 'sommelier'?
options: A trained wine professional who specializes in wine service and pairing

questions.question: In wine language, what does 'corked' mean?
options: The wine is tainted by a chemical compound (TCA) from a contaminated cork, giving it a musty flavor

questions.question: What does 'nose' refer to in wine tasting?
options: The overall aroma and smell of the wine

questions.question: In wine terminology, what is 'malolactic fermentation'?
options: A secondary fermentation converting sharp malic acid into softer lactic acid, creating a creamier texture

questions.question: What does 'oaky' describe in wine tasting?
options: Flavors of vanilla, spice, or toast imparted to wine by aging in oak barrels

questions.question: In wine language, what does 'brut' mean on a sparkling wine label?
options: Very dry, indicating very low sugar content
